A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Cinematography-5 stars
CGI-4.5 stars
Storyline-1 star
Character depth or backstory-0 stars
Character development-0 stars
Pacing of the movie-0 stars

Rian Johnson had claimed to be a huge fan\, but I'm left wondering if he had ever actually seen a Star Wars movie. Before this Rian had only directed 7 movies\, and I'd only heard of one of them. His inexperience in movie making really shines through in this epic failure. In the previous movie JJ Abrams did a great job of setting up his "mystery boxes" that left us wanting\, so all Rian had to do was answer those and add in a couple more. Instead\, the movie became a comedy that fell flat at every turn and was often met with silence from the audience. All the old characters were disrespected\, all the new characters became bumbling idiots who couldn't do anything right\, and of course the only competent character\, Mary Sue\, continued to be as we expected.
